abstract: Despite increasing regulatory pressure and weaker trading profits, banks increased the amount of derivatives on their books by $11.3 trillion in the third quarter, according to the O.C.C.
snippet: Despite increasing regulatory pressure and weaker trading profits, banks increased the amount of derivatives on their books by $11.3 trillion in the third quarter, according to the O.C.C.
lead_paragraph: Despite increasing regulatory pressure and weaker trading profits, banks increased the amount of derivatives on their books by $11.3 trillion in the third quarter, according to a report released Friday by the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
